benchmark_details.name: IFIR (Instruction-Following Information Retrieval)
benchmark_details.overview: IFIR is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate instruction-following information retrieval capabilities in expert domains like finance, law, healthcare, and scientific literature, encompassing 2,426 high-quality instruction-following examples with varying complexity.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate instruction-following capabilities of information retrievers across specialized domains and provide insights for model development.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset has a limited number of queries accompanied by instructions and does not provide a training dataset for future works.

data.source: Adapted from established traditional information retrieval benchmarks in expert domains (Finance, Law, Healthcare, Scientific Literature).

methodology.calculation: Both metrics evaluate the performance of the instruction-following retrieval systems, with INSTFOL specifically assessing the improvement gained by incorporating instructions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher nDCG and INSTFOL scores indicate better instruction-following capabilities and effective retrieval.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline performance was assessed against traditional retrieval models and instruction-tuned models.
methodology.validation: Extensive human expert validation during dataset construction.
